channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, November 26, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Founder's Day
item.description:
Wednesday, November 29, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support Founder's Day.

On Founder’s Day swara celebrates the lives and what would have been the 100th birthday of the wonderful Pink Twins and founders - Dorothy and Moyia O’Brien. The Pink twins were the first two female occupational therapists in Australia, with a passion for the colour pink which led to their affectionate nickname of ‘The Pink Twins’. Swara was founded by the Pink Twins in 1975 when they retired from occupational therapy, after they noticed the gap in the healthcare system for individuals with disabilities. This year would have also been the Pink Twin’s 100th birthday giving swara more reasons to celebrate the lives and legacy of the Pink Twins, and continue to empower the lives of those they help, so all can reach their full potential in a loving environment.

This Light Up is organised by: Swara Group

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Wednesday, November 29, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Lighting of the Christmas Tree
item.description:
Thursday, November 30, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate the Lighting of the Christmas Tree.

City Hall will be lit up to compliment the Lighting of the 2023 Christmas Tree. The Lord Mayor invites you to King George Square to join the Celebrations from 6.30pm.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.description:
Thursday, November 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lighting of the Christmas Tree
item.description:
Friday, December 1, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate the Lord Mayor's Lighting of the Christmas Tree.

It's that time of year once again! A standout event during Brisbane's annual festive celebrations is approaching - the Lord Mayor’s Lighting of the Christmas Tree, proudly presented by The Lott by Golden Casket. This event kicks off at 6.20 pm on Friday 1 December.

The festivities will include live musical performances of cherished Christmas tunes, including a special performance by Dami Im, as Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner illuminates the impressive 22-metre tree. This event marks the beginning of the Christmas festivities in Brisbane.

After this event, the Christmas Tree will remain in King George Square, providing an opportunity for everyone to snap photos and enjoy the festive season in The City.

For more information, visit the Christmas in Brisbane website.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World AIDS Day
item.description:
Friday, December 1, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World AIDS Day.

Queensland Positive People (QPP), is a peer-led, community-based organisation committed to improving the lives of all people living with HIV and help reduce new infections of HIV and STIs across Queensland. QPP's coordinates World AIDS Day in Queensland.

World AIDS Day is held on 1 December each year. It raises awareness across the world and in the community about HIV and AIDS. It is a day for the community to show their support for people living with HIV and to remember those who have been lost to the epidemic. On World AIDS Day 2022, Brisbane City Council and the Queensland Government signed the Fast Track Cities program, aiming to end HIV transmission globally.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Disability Action Week
item.description:
Saturday, December 2, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate Disability Action Week.

Running from November 25th, Disability Action Week is an opportunity to recognise the one in five people in our region living with disability and the role they play in our communities. The week's celebrations conclue on the 3rd of December with International Day of People with Disability. Through our organisation, we want to challenge the way people think about disability and help grow a more inclusive Queensland.  Sporting Wheelies and Disabled Association has its origins in the 1960s as a small sports club within the Paraplegic Welfare Association in Queensland. Sport for people with spinal cord injuries was gaining in popularity as a result of the first Paralympic Games in Rome in 1960, and the ‘Queensland Sports and Social Club for the Disabled’ played an active role in promoting disability sport and raising funds for Queensland athletes selected for national and international competitions.

This Light Up is organised by: Sporting Wheelies and Disabled Association

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: International Day of Persons with Disabilities
item.description:
Sunday, December 3, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to celebrate International Day of Persons with Disabilities.

International Day of People with Disability is held on 3 December each year, and is a United Nations observed day aimed at increasing public awareness, understanding and acceptance of people with disability.
It's a day to celebrate the achievements and contributions of people with disability. This year’s theme: ‘United in action to rescue and achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for, with and by persons with disabilities.’

The SDGs are 17 things countries want to work on by the year 2030 to make the world better and fairer for everyone. It is important that people with disability are part of this work and have a big say in what happens.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

Monday, December 4, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Annual Christmas Appeal.s charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Saturday, December 9, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in Brisbane.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family. Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by Queen Street in the Brisbane CBD for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances. For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

Find out what Brisbane has on offer this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: World Human Rights Day
item.description:
Sunday, December 10, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support World Human Rights Day.

Queensland Human Rights Commission works to protect and strengthen human rights in Queensland, and to help build a fairer, safer, and more inclusive community.

Human Rights Week runs from 1-10 December and is an annual initiative run by the Queensland Human Rights Commission to help raise awareness about human rights issues and the protections available under Queensland's Human Rights Act. It culminates on Human Rights Day, an international observance of the anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR). This Human Rights Day is the 75th anniversary of the UDHR.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Human Rights Commission

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Saturday, December 16, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Red and Green to support Christmas in Brisbane.

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family. Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by Queen Street in the Brisbane CBD for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances. For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

Find out what Brisbane has on offer this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Christmas in Brisbane
item.description:
Saturday, December 16, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in Brisbane.

The City will host an exciting Christmas program in 2023, bringing the spirit of Christmas to the locals and visitors during December.

Get ready to be captivated by the magical charm of Christmas at The Lott by Golden Casket City Hall Lights. Brisbane's iconic City Hall will transform into a lively canvas of stunning visuals and sounds of a Christmas story. The free show occurs every 15 minutes from 7.30pm to midnight daily from the 8th to the 24th of December.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
